verses.verse: When the Sabbath was over, Mary Magdalene, Mary, the mother of James, and Salome had bought sweet spices in order that they might come and anoint him.
Very early--at the rising of the sun--in the morning the first of the week, they came to the tomb.
They discussed among themselves, "Who will roll the stone away from the door of the tomb for us?"
When they looked, they saw that the stone was rolled away, for it was huge,
and entering the tomb they saw a young man sitting on the right side clothed in a long white garment, and they were afraid.
But he said to them, "Don't be afraid. You are looking for Jesus of Nazareth, who was crucified. He is risen. He is not here. See the place where they laid him!
"But go your way, tell his disciples and Peter that he goes ahead of you into Galilee. There you will see him, just as he said to you."
They left quickly and fled from the tomb, for they were shaking and amazed, neither did they say anything to anyone, for they were afraid.
Now when [Jesus] had risen, early the first of the week, he appeared first to Mary Magdalene, out of whom he had cast seven devils.
She went and told those who had been with him, while they mourned and wept.
But when they heard that he was alive and had been seen by her, they didn't believe it.
After that he appeared in another form to two of them as they walked and went into the country.
Then they went and told the rest, but they didn't believe them either.
Afterwards he appeared to the eleven as they sat to eat and rebuked them for their unbelief and hardness of heart, because they did not believe those who had seen him after he had risen.
And he said to them, "Go into all the world and preach the gospel to every creature.
"He who believes and is baptized will be saved, but he who doesn't believe will be condemned.
"These signs will follow those who believe. In my name will they cast out devils; they will speak with new tongues.
"They will pick up snakes, and if they drink any poisonous thing, it will not hurt them. They will lay hands on the sick, and they will get well."

So then after the Lord had spoken to them, he was taken up into heaven and sat at the right hand of God. 20 They went out and preached everywhere-the Lord working with them-and confirming the message with accompanying miraculous signs. Amen.
